vulnerability_type.name: Configuration
vulnerability_type.description: A vulnerability resulting from an error in the configuration and administration of a system or component.

vulnerability_type.name: Design
vulnerability_type.description: A vulnerability inherent in the design or specification of hardware or software whereby even a perfect implementation will result in a vulnerability.

vulnerability_type.name: Implementation
vulnerability_type.description: A vulnerability resulting from an error made in implementing software or hardware of a satisfactory design.

threat_type.name: Electronic/DoS and DDoS
threat_type.description: A Denial-of-Service (DoS) attack involves a malicious attempt to disrupt the operation of a computer system or network that is connected to the Internet. A Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attack is a more dangerous evolution of a DoS attack because it utilises a network of compromised zombie computers to mount the attack, so there is no identifiable single source.

threat_type.name: Electronic/Hacking
threat_type.description: Hackers want to get into your computer system and use them for their own purposes. There are many hacking tools available on the internet as well as online communities actively discussing hacking techniques enabling even unskilled hackers to break into unprotected systems. Hackers have a range of motives; from showing off their technical prowess, to theft of money, credentials or information, to cause damage.

threat_type.name: Electronic/Keystroke logging
threat_type.description: Keystroke loggers work by recording the sequence of key-strokes that a user types in. The more sophisticated versions use filtering mechanisms to only record highly prized information such as email addresses, passwords and credit card number sequences.

threat_type.name: Electronic/Malware
threat_type.description: Malware is any program or file that is harmful to a computer, the term covers viruses, worms, Trojan horses, and spyware. Malware is becoming increasingly sophisticated and can be used to compromise computers to install DOS zombie programs or other malicious programs.

threat_type.name: Electronic/Phishing and Spoofing
threat_type.description: Phishing describes a social engineering process designed to trick an organisation's customers into imparting confidential information such as passwords, personal data or banking and financial details. Most commonly these are criminal attacks but the same techniques could be used by others to get sensitive information.

threat_type.name: Insider/Manipulation
threat_type.description: Sometimes deliberate attempts are made to acquire information or access by manipulating staff by using a range of influencing techniques. This is sometimes described as social engineering, creating situations in which someone will willingly provide access to information, sites or systems to someone unauthorised to receive it. Customer facing personnel who have been trained to be helpful and informative can be particularly vulnerable to such attacks.

threat_type.name: Insider/Sabotage
threat_type.description: Saborage is often committed by a former employee seeking revenge on their employer because of a personal grudge caused by a negative work related event such as dismissal. Although it is sometimes planned well in advance, it can also be the result of an opportunistic moment.

goal_environment.name: Model
goal_environment.definition: To ensure the business continuity of Balkan Rail, the risk of damage by preventing security incidents and reducing their potential effects on Balkan Rail shall be minimised.

goal_environment.name: Model
goal_environment.definition: Balkan Rail information assets shall be protected against all internal, external, intentional or unintentional threats.

requirement.name: Data handling policy
requirement.description: A Data handling policy is to be implemented when dealing with confidential and commercially sensitive documentation
requirement.rationale: To provide documented procedures which are to be followed when transmitting confidential data internally within the company.
requirement.fit_criterion: The policy will detail specify the standard operating procedures for handling confidential data, depending on the classification it has been given. It will be signed off by IT, HR and executive management and detail the penalties of non compliance

requirement.name: Data classification policy
requirement.description: A data classification level will be applied to all confidential documentation that enters the company
requirement.rationale: Reduce the probability of mishandling of data
requirement.fit_criterion: Data classification levels will be documented and expressed in the form of a policy. The policy will contain criteria which must be met for the data classification level to be applied, and reference will be made to the correct handling procedures as per

requirement.name: RFID Management Policy
requirement.description: A policy detailing the procedure for replacing and stopping lost or stolen RFID cards will be implemented.
requirement.rationale: To ensure documented operating procedures for the use and management of ID Cards is provided and adhered to
requirement.fit_criterion: The policy will specify the points of contact for any card related issues and maintenance, as well as acceptable use by employees and instructions on how to handle lost or stolen ID cards.

requirement.name: RFID Cease requirement
requirement.description: Lost or Stolen RFID cards will have a cease lead time of 1 day (policy mandated) and employees will be required to report the lost or stolen card within 24 hours to the person defined in the RFID management policy
requirement.rationale: Reduce the risk of unauthorised access to Balkan Rail facilities through fraudulent use of RFID cards
requirement.fit_criterion: When a card is reported stolen, it will be ceased from operation by access control administrators within 1 day of report by the initial employee

requirement.name: RFID replacement card business process
requirement.description: An interim RFID card issue process will be implemented, allowing users access to resources while they wait for a new badge (a temporary badge will be issued)
requirement.rationale: Improve accountability and audit tracking of access to physical resources.
requirement.fit_criterion: The implemented policy will detail the process for replacing a lost card with a temporary assigned card, as well as reporting procedures for the incident in question

requirement.name: Data retention requirement
requirement.description: Recordings from the CCTV system will be stored for a predetermined and mutually agreed time duration
requirement.rationale: To provide evidence for following up of incidents of crime.
requirement.fit_criterion: Original copies of the recordings from cameras on the station will be stored with other CCTV recordings of the Balkan Rail main office in a bank safety deposit box.

requirement.name: CCTV Installation
requirement.description: The strategic placement of CCTV recording cameras
requirement.rationale: Ensure adequate surveillance capability is implemented covering critical areas of the station
requirement.fit_criterion: A site survey and consultation with the station manager will be carried out prior to installation of the CCTV cameras

requirement.name: CCTV installation
requirement.description: A full closed circut television system will be installed on the Central Station premises
requirement.rationale: Provide a deterrent from crime and cecords of security and saftey incerdents
requirement.fit_criterion: Provide a deterrent from crime and cecords of security and safety incidents
